info.title: USGS Water Services API
info.description: You can use this service to retrieve recent and historical values for streamflow as well as data for other regular time-series parameters served by the USGS. This service provides these USGS water data in Extensible Markup Language (XML), Javascript Object Notation (JSON) and the legacy RDB (tab-delimited) format currently available from the USGS Water Data for the Nation site External Link. More media types will follow.

get.description: A list of site numbers. You can specify up to 100 sites. Sites are comma separated. Sites may be prefixed with an optional agency code followed by a colon. If you don't know the site numbers you need, you can find relevant sites with the NWIS Mapper (http://wdr.water.usgs.gov/nwisgmap/index.html) or on the USGS Water Data for the Nation site (http://waterdata.usgs.ogv/nwis/)

parameters.name: sites
parameters.description: A list of site numbers. You can specify up to 100 sites. Sites are comma separated. Sites may be prefixed with an optional agency code followed by a colon. If you don't know the site numbers you need, you can find relevant sites with the NWIS Mapper (http://wdr.water.usgs.gov/nwisgmap/index.html) or on the USGS Water Data for the Nation site (http://waterdata.usgs.ogv/nwis/)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the response. The default is json. The supported formats are json, rdb, and xml.

parameters.name: parameterCd
parameters.description: A list of parameter codes. You can specify up to 100 parameter codes. Parameter codes are comma separated. If you don't know the parameter codes you need, you can find relevant parameter codes with the NWIS Mapper (http://wdr.water.usgs.gov/nwisgmap/index.html) or on the USGS Water Data for the Nation site (http://waterdata.usgs.ogv/nwis/)

If you don't know the site status codes you need, you can find relevant site status codes with the NWIS Mapper (http://wdr.water.usgs.gov/nwisgmap/index.html) or on the USGS Water Data for the Nation site (http://waterdata.usgs.ogv/nwis/)
